user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_device_open:
```c
int metal_device_open(const char *bus_name, const char *dev_name,
		      struct metal_device **device)
{
	struct metal_bus *bus;
	int error;

	if (!bus_name || !strlen(bus_name) ||
	    !dev_name || !strlen(dev_name) ||
	    !device)
		return -EINVAL;

	error = metal_bus_find(bus_name, &bus);
	if (error)
		return error;

	if (!bus->ops.dev_open)
		return -ENODEV;

	error = (*bus->ops.dev_open)(bus, dev_name, device);
	if (error)
		return error;

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_device_open:
int metal_bus_find(const char *name, struct metal_bus **result)
{
	struct metal_list *node;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	metal_list_for_each(&_metal.common.bus_list, node) {
		bus = metal_container_of(node, struct metal_bus, node);
		if (strcmp(bus->name, name) == 0 && result) {
			*result = bus;
			return 0;
		}
	}
	return -ENOENT;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided code (metal_device_open and metal_bus_find) and found no uses of memcmp, which is the function prohibited by MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 for comparing null-terminated strings. The only string operations present are strlen (used to check for empty strings) and strcmp (used in metal_bus_find to compare bus->name and name). Both strlen and strcmp operate on null-terminated strings and do not violate Rule 21.14. The indirect call (*bus->ops.dev_open)(...) is to an external implementation not shown here; that implementation would need to be checked separately for memcmp misuse, but the code fragments provided do not themselves contain memcmp and therefore do not need investigation under Rule 21.14.
